Q1_1: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...knows who you are?
Q1_2: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...helps you feel comfortable asking questions and making comments in class?

Q1_4: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...makes you feel like part of the classroom community?

Q5_1: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...clearly explains what you are expected to learn in the class?

Q5_3: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...provides assignments/activities that are useful in helping you learn the course material?

Q10_1: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...is excited about the subject and shares this excitement with the class?
Q10_2: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...uses in-class problem solving, and other interactive approaches?
Q10_3: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...creates an environment where you interact with and learn from other students?
Q10_4: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...makes students feel interested and engaged?
Q10_5: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...encourages students to think critically and question assumptions?
Q10_6: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...relates the course material to real-world applications?
Q10_7: In your classes, how important is it that your professor... - • ...encourages students to take time to reflect on their own learning?

Q3: Actually realizing that I am a student that has other external factors that may affect my academic studies and realize that I am a hardworking student and not to generalize me as a student who is going to take advantage of them. I pride myself in being an honest student and a hardworking one, to be lumped into a category is quite honestly disrespectful.
Q8: Going over homework and the homework questions before class actually starting. This is to help answer any homework questions that we may have and instead of asking the professor individually. I know a lot of other students may be a bit timid or shy to ask questions and sometimes for those who aren’t, they’re also able to benefit from it as well. In addition, I believe that it may also make them feel more comfortable in asking questions once they’re familiarized or feeling more comfortable in a safe environment to do so.

Q16: I feel that the survey accurately understands what makes a good professor. However, I feel that many of these great attributes are not found in classes because students don't feel safe sharing a wrong answer. This is something that almost every student experiences. I am not sure exactly what the solution is, however, I do believe that a friendly and social professor makes all the difference.
